185883639.review:
Познакомился с этой игрой ещё в детстве. Помню, у нас жил какой-то мужик, и он был то ли парнем моей двоюродной сестры (а она жила тогда с нами), то ли другом семьи. Мои родители приютили его в нашем доме, поскольку у него были какие-то нескладушки с жильём. Ну и вот, по сути он заехал в нашу хату со шматьём, зубной щёткой, полотенцами, ботинками ... И компьютером!

У него был компудахтер, да, а у нас не было(((. Да ещё какой компудахтер был! С ИГРАМИ!!! И я точно помню, как познакомился с этой жестянкой: подхожу, значит, к столу, а там стоит монитор. На нём во всю гоняла машина какая-то, да так гоняла, что по бокам машины всё съёживалось от скорости! И надо же - этой машиной управляли кнопками на клавиатуре! То туда повернули, то сюда - послушная тачка, однако! Тогда я вообще не мог себе представить, что такое может быть ... Я ещё толком от Сеги не мог отойти, а тут вот это!

Конечно, тогда я не знал, что то, что я вижу на экране - может иметь какое-то название. По сути для меня что у Сеги, что у компьютера отличительными знаками игрушек были иконки на рабочем столе или картриджи с картинками соответственно. Поэтому я и знать не знал как эта игра называлась. А называлась она Need for Speed: Most Wanted. С этой игры и началась моя "история компьютерных игрушек" (звучит как идея для нового мультфильма Пиксар).

И вот пока я пытался совладать с управлением тачки - мои родители во всю резались в какую-то непонятную мне, но зрелищную игру. На рабочем столе она отображалась двумя иконками: шлемом и какой-то девкой на синем фоне. И вот мама чуть ли не десятками часов сидела и клацала мышкой, наводя курсор то на сундуки, то на всяких нечистей, то на торговцев и всяких людишек с ромбиками и восклицательными знаками ... Название этой игры я запомнил хорошо. Думаю, это было связано с тем, что данная (по описанию, конечно) игра нравилась моей маме, а что нравилось тогда маме - нравилось и всей семье (кроме котов, конечно, потому что им было на всё это по-барабану). Называлась она Titan Quest Immortal Throne.

По сути можно говорить о том, что игра стала "игрой семьи", поскольку рубились в неё от мала, до велика! Да, я тоже пытался в неё играть, но в силу детской невнимательности и отсутствия повышенной концентрации на игре в моменты затишья, - я то здесь, то там оказывался в западне врагов и стремительно умирал. Читать я тоже не очень умел, поэтому прокачивать навыки "правильно" я тупо не мог, поэтому всякие "товарищи со звёздочками", или боссы локаций лупили меня почём зря ... Короче, мне нравилось больше смотреть и потом, вдохновившись мамиными подвигами, пытаться двигаться в игре уже самостоятельно. Но у меня всё равно ничего не получалось)) ... Детство ...))

Всё это длилось какой-то промежуток времени. По сути тот мужик, о котором я говорил в самом начале, собрался съезжать. А раз он начал собирать свои монатки - ботинки, полотенца, зубную щётку, одежду ... - значит, он заберёт и свой компьютер! Я ни черта не помню как тогда отреагировал на это обстоятельство, но мне кажется, что я был всем этим очень недоволен.

Ну и что думаете? Он свалил, не оставив и болта (от компудахтера, конечно)! Было грустно, наверно (опять же, ни черта не помню, что там было). Но была Сега, и она работала ... Короче, выбирать тогда не приходилось.

И только в 2013 году у моей семьи появился собственный компьютер! И знаете какая игра была установлена на него в первую же очередь? Она самая - Titan Quest! И рубились мы в неё долго и счастливо (по чему-то там текло, да в рот ... Ну и что-то там!).

Вот такая семейная история связана у меня с этой игрой. А что насчёт самой игры? Да в принципе я думаю, что вы итак всё о ней хорошо знаете!

Конэц

185803523.review:
I fully recommend this game. Read on if you want to know why.

The pros:
Although this game was released in 2006 the graphics are still holding up with nowadays games.
But not only the graphics are great even the artstyle is an outstandig masterpiece.
It's not too dark or too colorful.
The game is set in pre-roman ironage mixed up with mythologie.
It's a really well fitiing and unspent setting.
The character progression and skilling is interesting.
The sound ambient and music is well made and catching.
The developer delivered all of the tools the games have been made with, so you can make your own Titan Quest mod or total conversion.

The cons:
The controls feel a bit clumpy. You often get stuck on small clutter on the ground you're barely seeing.
The game doesn't recognize when you're pressing multiple buttons at once for activating skills for example.
This can be the reason why you die rather quickly and thats frustrating.
Sometimes the frames drop at a low rate when special effects like rain or snow are showing.
Even though you can expand your bag the room to hoard stuff is very limited. You need to use third-party-tools like TQVault to expand you stash.
This also applies to the attributes like strength, dexterity, intelligence etc. You need to use third-party-tools to reset them.
The devs have added some lategame contenct but it's not enough to keep the players busy imo.

All in all it's a great game that you should play.

[h1]Sum-Up[/h1]
[h3]In-depth analysis further down.[/h3]

[table]
[tr]
[th]🟩 [b]Pros[/b][/th]
[th]🟥 [b]Cons[/b][/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]
• Excellent variety of class building possibilities thanks to dual multiclassing and a plethora of skills for each.

• Decent overall variety of enemies, most of which have different behaviors and unique abilities.

• Good diversity of locations, all well-made and consistent, with many references to mythology and philosophy.
[/td]
[td]
• Tremendously slow, unsatisfying progression, compounded with severe content bloating.

• Miserable bosses that hardly prove a challenge with any half-decent build.

• Top-tier vanilla class abilities are locked behind a DLC paywall.

• Boring exploration that features no events of any kind, limited randomization, and unrewarding secrets.

• Painfully-paced combat with outrageous cooldowns for an ARPG, unresponsive controls and ultra-jank melee.
[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[table]
[tr]
[th]🟨 [b]Bugs & Issues[/b][/th]
[th]🔧 [b]Specs[/b][/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]
• Random crashes may occur when transitioning areas and make you lose progress.

• UI doesn’t scale well in 4K, making many elements too small.

• Barebones loot filtering system that doesn’t allow any customization past basic tier exclusion.
[/td]
[td]
• i9 13980HX
• 64GB RAM DDR5
• RTX 4090
• NvME SSD
• 3840x2160
[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[table]
[tr]
[td][b]Content & Replay Value:[/b][/td]
[td]It took me, with another player in co-op, around 34 hours to complete Titan Quest on the standard difficulty (the only one available on your first run), taking extra time to finish all side quests and fully explore each area. The replay value is decent with the multi-class possibilities, however everything else stays the same on harder difficulties.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Do I recommend it?[/b][/td]
[td]No. Despite some good points, Titan Quest is, ultimately, a mind-numbing slog. It doesn’t do anything that countless other ARPGs have done before or after its time, and has no specific features or qualities that set its own identity.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][h3]Conclusion[/h3][/td]
[td]An infuriatingly generic and poorly-paced ARPG: monotony and repetition soon overtake any and all enjoyment—its vast class-building simply isn’t enough to keep it afloat in an ocean of unambitious, boring design choices.[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[quote]Follow our [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41449676/]Curator[/url] and [url=https://summitreviews.biz]Website[/url] to see more high-quality reviews regularly.[/quote]

[h1]In-Depth[/h1]
[h3]Writing & Worldbuilding[/h3]
Titan Quest’s ancient Fantasy setting, spanning from Greece to African regions and even higher planes of existence such as Hades (Hell) and Elysium (Heaven), is overall detailed, consistent and well-made visually and artistically. Despite its age, the visuals hold up well enough, and the ragdoll physics add some dynamicity to an otherwise very static combat feel. If you enjoy historical settings, you’ll feel right at home. 

Given that deep, meaningful plots are never a priority in this genre, efforts have been made in other iconic titles to, at least, grant a semblance of interest to the various tasks at hand, take Diablo II for example. That doesn’t happen in Titan Quest, however. Whereas the main story is generic but serviceable, any and all side characters or quests are inconsequential—their middle school grade writing only worsens the dullness of tasks already repetitive by nature. You’ll find no interest whatsoever in any of the admittedly iconic characters you’ll meet, such as great ancient heroes and even demigods, all stripped of any pathos or epicness they may have had.

[h3]Exploration & Secrets[/h3]
You’ll explore each area on foot, your only means of transport besides two-way portals that allow fast-travel to discovered locations, such as cities, to sell loot, use facilities and restock consumables—the standard ARPG fare. Notably, quest givers aren’t highlighted when it’s time to return a completed quest, so good luck remembering where “Generic NPC I Forgot The Name Of’’ is located. The average speed of your character is inadequate to traverse any area in a decent time; with how large each map is, you’ll find yourself walking more than fighting, since enemy density is subpar. You’ll often ask yourself when the current area will end, because you’re fed up with it already.

Each map has plenty of side-areas and dungeons that often host Elite or Boss enemies guarding higher-tier chests that have a chance to spawn the best loot. Exploring is worthwhile to mop up as much XP as you can, but not so much for loot since most chests, including “secret” ones, have miserable rewards. The satisfaction of finding a secret dungeon, clearing it and getting some actual good loot from it is almost always absent.

[h3]Combat System & Bosses[/h3]
The combat gameplay, of course, will change based on your Masteries (classes) of choice, ranging from pure casters to summoners, melee specialists, archers, rogues, and why not, a mix of all the above. The amount of combinations is staggering, with a relatively cheap respec option available at any town for skills. The standard ARPG system of mana, health and related potions is in place, plus an array of consumable Scrolls that have a variety of unique effects, purchased for a high price or rarely found. Should you perish in combat, a feat not easy to achieve due to the generally tame challenge posed by your foes, an XP penalty is applied, having you return to your death-mark to reclaim it; nothing else is lost.

The cooldowns. Good lord the cooldowns. Of any ARPG I have played, Titan Quest takes the cake for the slowest, most infuriating cooldown timers. Whoever thought a 30 seconds cooldown on the basic Taunt skill for a tank (which doesn’t work properly half the time anyway) or even 60 second ones on caster skills were good ideas, should take a break from game development and play some Diablo II to see how it’s done.

Even if the enemy variety is good in a general sense, most maps overextend and bloat for too long, having you fight countless of the same fodder far past what would be ideal for this genre. The Elite and Boss enemies aren’t unique or meaningful enough to grant the needed diversity. Speaking of higher-tier enemies, unless you go against one that is twenty levels above you, you won’t have much problems dealing with them, at least on the default difficulty setting. Most of them are miserable, generic, and just don’t stand out enough from the crowd save for some different color or aura around them. I died a total of five times in the whole game, which isn’t a lot. 

[h3]Character Progression[/h3]
By killing enemies and completing quests, you’ll level up and receive 3 Skill and 2 Attribute points each time. You can also get these as quest rewards, alongside other unique bonuses like +% damage, but that’s a rare occurrence. 

You’ll also loot charms from enemies and chests, which can be used on weapons to bestow passive traits that compound your build, and also reused by destroying the weapon to get the charm back and then put it on a better one.

Leveling up in Titan Quest is tremendously slow: by the end of the campaign, after doing everything, I was just level 37; the level cap is 75. That’s less than one level per hour, which may be fine for the last 10-20 levels in an ARPG, when your build is already shaped up, but it’s a depressing affair so early. Your gameplay evolves slowly, frustratingly so: your combat experience will stay the same for hours on end if you decide to focus on a few skills, which is the only way to make them worth using to begin with. Also, you’ll also have to spend skill points to increase your Mastery level and access higher tier skills, further sinking more points into passive stats instead of active skills that evolve your class’ gameplay.

185433107.review:
Overall there are many aspects of the game to appreciate: large areas for a game from the mid 2000s, fun gameplay, rewarding loot, skill and build variety, variability in the areas you visit, and a cool Grecian theme to name just a few. A lot of effort went into bringing back the only real challenger to the Diablo Throne that I have ever player personally, even if many aspects of the game are dated by today's standards. 

The only issue I really have with the game is the lack of optimization, which is somewhat understandable considering the age of the game, but the stuttering and FPS drops can be really off putting at times. I've researched a lot of recommendations stemming from disabling the Steam Overlay, eliminating cloud sync, setting the game to utilize legacy OS such as Windown XP or Direct X9, etc., but the game continues to have issues regardless what you do: though these things are still recommended as they may provide some benefit for new players. 

I highly suggest use Cheat Engine to speed up gameplay and increase the enemies in places where it is stable as this really makes it much more fun due to the slow movement speed, attack speed, and large fairly sparse areas in certain parts of the game. I also recommend using the TQVault, a fantastic app, as this will make storing and transferring gear between toons much less stressful: there are 11 masteries and you have a primary and secondary mastery to create classes, so there are many permutations to experiment with and you will want something to help manage all the loot you get :)

185181483.review:
In Titan Quest Anniversary Edition schlüpfen wir in die Sandalen eines Helden, der es mit einer Meute mythologischer Kreaturen aufnimmt. Klingt episch, oder? Nun, das ist es auch – aber nicht ohne eine ordentliche Portion Lachtränen.

Unsere Reise beginnt im antiken Griechenland, wo wir prompt in die erste skurrile Situation stolpern: ein wildes Durcheinander, das von bösartigen Ziegen angeführt wird. Ja, Ziegen. Diese pelzigen Unruhestifter sind nicht zu unterschätzen. Wer hätte gedacht, dass ausgerechnet sie zu unseren ersten Gegnern zählen? Macht schon mal den Ziegenbock-Parade-Modus bereit!

Doch die wahre Komik entfaltet sich, wenn wir unsere unfreiwilligen Tanzpartner, die Satyren, treffen. Mit ihren Posaunen und Tänzen sehen sie eher aus wie Musiker auf einem Jahrmarkt als ernstzunehmende Gegner. Aber Achtung: Sie können dennoch gehörig austeilen. Sobald wir sie besiegt haben, machen wir uns auf den Weg nach Ägypten, wo uns Mumien erwarten, die vermutlich von den Binden ihres letzten Karnevals noch benommen sind.

Natürlich wäre das Spiel nicht vollständig ohne die epische Bosskämpfe, bei denen selbst der tapferste Held ins Schwitzen gerät. Doch auch hier bleibt der Humor nicht auf der Strecke. Wenn der letzte Kampf gegen den Titanen erreicht ist und dieser heroisch ins Gras beißt, können wir nicht anders als zu lachen – vor allem, wenn der Koloss eine theatralische, beinharte Tanznummer hinlegt, bevor er das Zeitliche segnet.

Das ist Titan Quest Anniversary Edition – ein Spiel, das dich nicht nur in die Tiefen der Mythologie entführt, sondern auch immer wieder mit seiner charmanten Skurrilität und humorvollen Einlagen überrascht. Wer hätte gedacht, dass Götter und Monster so viel Spaß machen können?

Fazit: Zieh deine Sandalen an, lade deinen Bogen, und mach dich bereit für ein Abenteuer voller Lacher und legendären Momenten. Diese Titanen wissen, wie man eine Show abzieht!

185136160.review:
ARPG muito bom. Quem espera algo tipo Skyrim ou Witcher, com profundidade de história e quests, naturalmente vai se decepcionar. É um Dungeon crawler isométrico com loot, monstros e habilidades em primeiro lugar, muito ao estilo Diablo 2 ou as primeiras seasons do Mu Online, embora com muito mais variedades de builds, loot, habilidades, mapas e etc que o último.

Das cerca de 10 especializações, todas podem ser combinadas em uma maestria única, com estilos de jogos totalmente diferentes, algumas mais ou menos fáceis de jogar, mas todas viáveis.

Eu já havia feito o Review de torchlight ou torchlight 2, e estão na mesma categoria de jogo, mas TQ é muito mais variado em mapas e monstros, portanto não é cansativo como TC.

Resumindamente, não é um RPG de estórias, e sim um RPG de builds e habilidades, com NG+ e NG++, diferentes um do outro, onde o personagem se especializa, torna-se mais forte e recebe loots melhores, com a dificuldade proporcional. E, se for esclarecedor, é do mesmo criador de Grim Dawn.

Por fim, acho injusto comparar TQ com o que ele não é: um ARPG ao estilo western. Deve-se ter em conta ele ser sim um ARPG isométrico ao estilo Diablo 2, com muito loot e builds muito variadas. Nesse quesito ele brilha imensamente.

(Tenho muitas horas não logadas, por isso o marcador steam mostra pouco tempo).

184825315.review:
Il y a des jeux qui marquent une époque. Titan Quest en fait partie.

Passionné par la Grèce antique depuis mon plus jeune âge et profondément ancré dans une spiritualité hélléniste, ce jeu c'est une sorte de rêve devenu réalité. Nous sommes en 2006, peu de productions permettent de vivre des aventures en Grèce Antique, alors, lorsque Titan Quest sort, c'est une révolution ! Imaginez-vous arpenter les chemins de l’Antiquité, côtoyant à la fois les dieux, les héros, et les créatures mythologiques, dans une aventure qui vous pousse sans cesse à devenir plus fort. C'est ce que TQ proposait et c'était une bombe dans le domaine vidéo-ludique.

Déjà en avance sur son temps en 2006, mélange parfait entre le jeu de rôle et l’action-RPG à la Diablo, TQ nous entraîne dans un voyage épique à travers trois grandes civilisations mythologiques : la Grèce antique, l’Égypte et l’Orient (Ajoutez l'Atlantide et les Nordiques si vous prenez les DLC). Chaque région regorge de détails soignés, de paysages enchanteurs, et d’ennemis iconiques issus des mythes. Vous combattez des centaures, des gorgones, des scarabées géants, et même des Titans eux-mêmes dans un combat titanesque pour sauver l’humanité. Une approche simple mais parfaitement orchestrée. Car oui, Titan Quest n’est pas qu’un jeu de combat : c’est une sorte de voyage initiatique, une odyssée. Plus on progresse, plus on ressent la montée en puissance de notre héros. Cette progression donne l’impression de passer de simple mortel à demi-dieu. Ce sentiment d’accomplissement est rare dans un jeu, et Titan Quest le maîtrise à la perfection.

De plus, avec l’Anniversary Edition (que j'ai repris sur STeam), les développeurs ont prouvé qu’ils respectaient leur propre héritage. Cette version modernisée améliore tout ce qui faisait déjà la grandeur de l’original. Les graphismes ont été affinés sans perdre leur charme d’antan, les mécaniques ont été peaufinées pour être plus fluides et équilibrées, et de nombreux correctifs ont été ajoutés pour offrir une expérience encore plus agréable. Mais ce qui frappe le plus, c’est que même 17 ans après, Titan Quest n’a pas pris une ride en termes de plaisir de jeu. La richesse des classes (incroyable), le système de compétences double (permettant de créer des combinaisons uniques comme un guerrier-sorcier ou un chasseur-défenseur), et l’exploration de vastes cartes ouvertes font de ce jeu une véritable pépite qui traverse les âges. Si nous ajoutons le Multi, on comprend aisément pourquoi c'est une aussi grande référence.

Pour tout amateur de mythologie comme moi, Titan Quest est une invitation à vivre les récits épiques de l’Antiquité. Quand je parcours la plaine de Marathon, que je traverse les portes de Babylone ou que je gravis les sommets du Mont Olympe, je ressens vraiment un côté épique que peu de jeux ont réussi à me prodiguer. Le respect des récits mythologiques se mêle parfaitement à une liberté d’interprétation artistique qui rend ce monde vivant et cohérent. Enfin, une nouvelle étoile brille à l’horizon : Titan Quest 2, prévu pour 2025 ! L’idée de replonger dans ce monde mythologique avec des graphismes modernes et des mécaniques encore plus riches me remplit d’une véritable excitation. Si Titan Quest a su capturer l’essence de la mythologie dans un jeu vidéo, je suis convaincu que le second opus sera une apothéose pour tous les amoureux de récits antiques. Vous l'aurez compris Titan Quest Anniversary Edition n’est pas juste un jeu, c’est une expérience, une aventure qui transcende le temps et les époques. ue vous soyez amateur d’action-RPG, passionné de mythologie, ou simplement curieux de découvrir une œuvre magistrale, ce jeu est un incontournable

184521383.review:
泰坦之旅算是很多90年代人的童年回忆了。

[b]作为一个类暗黑游戏，这游戏最大优点是职业非常非常丰富，职业专精10选2可以有多达45种组合。游戏的音乐氛围感也比较足。[/b]
在当年这还是少有的有中国主题章节的外国游戏，虽然老外对中国元素的理解比较搞笑（比如清朝造型的皇帝却用着秦朝兵马俑守卫陵墓，陵墓还在皇城里面），但还是给中国玩家一种亲切感。

[b]游戏缺点主要是部分职业战斗不够爽快，技能不够多，在战斗时的动画演出表现比较保守。[/b]
比如征服者这个热门职业（战斗专精+防御专精），虽然输出和生存数值都很高经常被推荐给新人，但绝大部分技能都是有一定冷却时间的buff技能(巨人形态、重整旗鼓、军旗等)，推图时战斗的体验就是平砍再平砍，偶尔用一下盾冲，虽然强但是玩着有点乏味。

[b]另一个缺点是，后续的部分DLC章节地图过于庞大，路线不明确，比如永恒余烬DLC加的中国和埃及新地图又大又绕，时常让人陷入不知往何处去的困惑。[/b]

最后这游戏里降低敌人抗性非常重要，可以大幅度提升输出，这导致很多战士武器装备都是污染掉落池的陪衬，最终配置里永远都是用那些降抗性的武器......不过瑕不掩瑜，总的来说这个游戏还是不错的，如果你喜欢暗黑破坏神，那大概也能在这里找到乐趣。

184334712.review:
Such a classic. 
I remember not being able to come far in this game when I played it nearly 20 years ago, but still loved it quite a lot despite  getting my ass handed to me. Revisiting it after a long time definitely doesn't make me like it any less too, still a fantastic game, even though it does feel a bit dated now. I still haven't tried all the classes though, because there's just so many to choose from, but I definitely intend to. In case you're wondering what that means, this game basically lets you choose 2 so-called masteries, which are something like specialisations/talent trees, and each unique combination of two masteries results in a different class for your character (there's a total of 11 masteries, so due to a lot of possible combinations between them, quite a lot of classes are available). I also love that there's no seasonal stuff like in many other ARPGs, here you have your character and you have it forever, it ports to higher difficulties and everything if you want to continue playing it, you don't have to make completely new characters for each of the new seasons and similar stuff. My only gripe with this game is that the higher difficulty isn't directly available if you want to play it. Some of the content is also only available on the highest difficulty, and to be able to play the highest difficulty you first need to beat the entire game and the expansions on each of the lower difficulties first. Basically you have to beat the entire game on normal difficulty first before you can do epic difficulty, and only after beating the entire game on epic difficulty as well you're allowed into legendary difficulty, which is very time consuming, especially if you intend to do it on more than one character. But generally I absolutely can only recommend this game, it's great and lots of fun. I've played through the entire campaign with another person recently, so I can also say that multiplayer works great as well and is super fun

Начитавшись хвалебных обзоров, я радостный побежал покупать игру, первые минуты игры всё было не так уж и плохо, вроде иду, кого то убиваю, хоть и простым закликиванием мыши.
Но уже спустя час мне стало неясно, почему игра имеет хоть то восторженные отзывы(Не считая людей, которые с детства играли в неё).
Что конкретно не понравилось? Невероятно скучный и унылый геймплей и просто непонятные моменты по типу квеста, где мне надо убить здоровенного минотавра с кучей жизней и огромным уроном(Я не нашёл другого способа его убить кроме как заманить к спартанцем и пока он отвлёкся на них, бить его, даже с такой тактикой жизни у него уходили очень нехотя), я принимаю тот факт, что возможно я просто не разобрался в игре и я даже буду рад если это так и кто-нибудь в комментариях к обзору объяснит мне, что я делал не так. В любом случае, в моём понимании, игры должны быть интуитивно понятными и объяснять игроку, что от него требуется.
Не понравилась система лута: миллион выпадающих из всех щелей бесполезных шмоток, и каждый раз просто неудобно бегать и рассматривать каждую характеристику, чтобы понять, нужна ли тебе эта вещь или нет.
В заключении скажу, что я не являюсь хейтером старых игр, но конкретно Titan Quest я не понял, и буду рад, если вдруг кто-нибудь в комментариях сможет меня переубедить.
(Писал обзор на эмоциях, поэтому не судите за расстановку знаков препинания.)

184119306.review:
Titanquest genre is ARPG but kind of a slow burn one, maybe not in 500h per character sense but it will feel like it. It is bit old in the end, but i wanted to give it a playthrough anyway so here i'm. Oh and also to mention i played without any DLCs, because i already have Grim dawn and i feel like i already have enchanted and better version of this game.
But i'm not going to review mister big Grim dawn, it's Titanquest and i believe that it has couple good things about it and ehm... Some disgusting ones.

So i will start with those bad ones! I freaking hate level design of this game and how samey they feel, you have forest, forest but white or dork, cave, ice cave, tomb that layout is square x10. There are few good areas that look neat especially the boss arenas and perhaps some of the later ones... And it's kind of a bummer because this game has many different places you go through like Greece, Egypt, Orient, you even go down to kick Hades ass, but yeah a lot of areas just feel, like i just walk and walk with no end, good example is that Minoan Labyrinth, corridors that look the same, same enemies i fight over and over just tp me into the boss fight, i don't care anymore, too much boring layouts and needless walking.

Along with the levels you going to encounter similiar working mobs, i'm not saying they have same models they just do same function, you going to meet rattle meh bone skeletons multiple times, archers and some other ones, i honestly don't remember i only have bosses in my storage mind, you only maybe start paying attention to mobs after you get chain stunned into oblivion, if your hp goes down drink liter worth of potions and you either die or move forward, whatgives, perhaps DLCs would help or it's just an age thingy, but pair it up with issue above and it start being an problem.

But we are going to move on from that part, because i want to share that idea of attributes in this game sucks, it was most likely a problem of my underleveled journey, BUT! I couldn't wear anything, without big attribute investment, even when i was meeting the level requirement or i had items to help with that, at some point i said to myself that i have to stop using one-handed and just main staff, which is... Two handed? Only, i don't know there are no wands in this game, i wanted to go for shield(earth and defense mastery) but yeah, i dislike having extreme limited choice of gear and i went for fire damage, so i had choice of only taking fire staff, attributes requirement could be tuned dow

Did i already mention that game is slow? Game seemingly likes default attack for early game, sorry whole game and it elevates the slog experience.

Yeah, uhh right
If you read so far, i know you might be thinking "Why this dude put a positive blue review on this thing? This bobby fella clearly doesn't like it", but don't worry i'm moving on to goody things of Titanquest now.

And i begin with progression, character progression, i like it and nothing in this game feels meaningless, except maybe attributes, levels? You get upgrade, items? Upgrade, Enchantments you put on items? Also an upgrade. They feel important and they can fix issues of your character, it doesn't feel like my character is attached to gear or i can put whatever the fuc i can on my character and it will work, it's an important aspect of ARPG and this game does it noice, even when some things are hard to get, they are still farmable and despite it being long it will feel rewarding at the end.
Loot drops are not too terrible either, i mostly managed to find items i wanted, some elemental dmg trinkets, needed stats, !movement speed!, resistances for some of the fights.

Difficulty is good as well and not a point and click adventure, you going to get slapped, you will have to avoid things and i mostly died because of my own fault and not some bullshittery that game decided to pull off, some debuffs don't feel fun to deal with but are managable.
And speaking of avoiding attacks, bosses are great in Titanquest, they have their rad models, unique arenas, movesets and even enviroment hazards to deal with, i love that a lot of work been put into those guys, i for example didn't even know that engine can handle boss tossing rocks from enviroment, it's bit jank but i cannot say it's not cool at least and that's exactly how they feel to fight with, compared to walking sim to get to them. It is one of major points why i gave this game positive.

Sound design is okay, i didn't find anything out of place except bass-boosted level up sound, music fits and always feel on point with the theme of the location, nothing bad in here and i even liked couple, especially ones with vocals. Voice acting is stellar, i don't care about other opinions, in my thonk brain i believe they are memorable("Your goods are safe with me :)" ) and i feel joy whenever actors try their best to sound unique, different emotion seethe through dialogues and i always wondered how the next smith or merchant will sound like, it's more comedy compared to other ARPG titles that are usually grim and serious, refreshing, is nice.

I think that's about it, i know why people like this game, if i played it while back i would clearly enjoy the game more, right now i just find myself pulled to other titles, still not too bad playthrough, it's nice to see developers learn from mistakes and improve over time, couple people that done this game went to make Grim dawn and trust me they learned.

I recommend to check but it's not mandatory, be wary it's not pristine.

184108942.review:
Titan Quest n’est pas un mauvais jeu, il commence à dater un peu, édition originale en 2006 puis remaster en 2016.

Les + (avec les - associés):

1 – L’originalité du jeu vient de son scénario basé sur des récits de la mythologie. On y affronte des créatures et des héros et des dieux de cette époque .
2 – On nous fait voyager dans plusieurs pays à forte influence mythologique (Grèce, Égypte, Mésopotamie (Babylone), la Chine, la Scandinavie (Vikings) et même l’Atlantide (le mythe).
3 – Les cartes sont vastes, il faut un certain temps pour les traverser.
4 – Les histoires principales sont intéressantes.
5 – Les musiques sont très belle.
6 – Ce n’est graphiquement pas encore trop moche, certains temples et extérieurs rendent vraiment bien, les personnages et les monstres aussi.
7 – Le système de craft et de combinaisons d’objets présent.
8 – Les différentes classes de personnages.
9 – Les loots nombreux.

Les - :
1 – Mais On déchante vite les 2 premiers actes sont sympas mais après ça tourne rapidement au n’importe quoi, en plus on a l’impression de « survoler » toutes ces légendes est mythes, il y aurait tellement eu à faire en plus …
2 – Mais : J’ai apprécié la Grèce, l’Égypte, l’Atlantide, le reste m’a ennuyé.
3 – Trop vastes, on a un seul chemin prédéfini à chaque fois pour progresser sur la quête principale, ils nous font bien tourner en rond par de multiples chemins pour bien se farcir tout le carte (ponts cassés, pierres qui bloquent le passage, barrières, Etc.), bref le level design est mauvais.
4 – Mais pas toutes et il y a trop peu de quêtes secondaires
5 – La plupart sont belles mais certaines sont juste des boucles assez courtes, celles là deviennent rapidement pénibles à écouter.
6 – Mais les effets visuels commencent à piquer les yeux, ça manque de cinématiques, le jeu arrive à lagguer sur des configs puissantes, il y a aussi des bugs de caméras (sur certains niveaux de zoom on ne voit plus notre personnage, il se retrouve caché par le décor), les monstres sont souvent identiques et changent très peu d’une zone à l’autre.
7 – Mais tellement lourd et long pour un jeu solo, il faut 5 parties de relique pour en avoir un complète, elle ne tombent pas en quantité égales (les reliques de la partie Chine on en ramasse à la pelle, les autres beaucoup moins), la lourdeur aussi d’avoir plusieurs versions (Normales ; épiques, légendaires) alors que seules les normales servent au craft.
8 – Mais on a vite fait le tour, personnellement j’aime bien les classes à distance avec des compagnons mais …
Malheureusement le jeu est mal fichu pour les armes à distance, on se retrouve sans cesse à devoir bouger car nos projectiles tapent dans des obstacles … Le pire ce sont les escaliers et les dénivelés de terrain, nos projectiles se plantent dans le sol et ne touche pas la cible …
9 – Mais le jeu est bien trop radin en mode solo, pour compléter un set il faut compter un temps de jeu considérable … Par contre le trash ça ne manque pas …

Bref en 2025 je ne conseille pas ce jeu (en 2016 ça devait encore aller), mais globalement je me suis ennuyé, les cartes sont trop grandes et bourrées d’ennemis, on tourne en rond pour trouver le bon chemin, il y a beaucoup de grottes, temples, catacombes, Etc. qui ne servent à rien à part aller taper des monstres, il n’y a aucune quête associé, rien d’intéressant,c’est le vide sidéral.

J’ai rushé pas mal de passages tellement c’était long et pénible à faire (Trop de monstres, trrop de chemin à parcourir, etc.), je l’ai terminé une fois mais quelle perte de temps ce jeu, je ne relancerais pas une partie !!!

Titan Quest — це ще одна відеогра, яка вийшла в моєму дитинстві. Далекий 2006 рік. Є ностальгія — перший комп’ютер із монітором на 17».

Водночас повноцінну увагу цій грі зміг приділити тільки у 2024 році. Коли згадав, що в мене в бібліотеці Steam є — Titan Quest Anniversary Edition. [b]Якісний HD-ремастер 2016 року[/b]. До якого THQ Nordic видали три додаткові великі DLC з новими регіонами, класами та механіками гри.

[b]Переваги цієї гри:[/b]
1. Можна згадати стару добру класику, початок ARPG жанру ігор, рубанину.
2. У грі є українська локалізація. Інтерфейс гри та текст у завданнях.
3. Величезна варіативність класів та прокачки персонажа. Є сайти-гайди, калькулятори. Відразу згадуєш Diablo.
4. У гру можна грати, коли є настрій — це може бути 30–60 хв або більше. Як кажуть, трішки відволіктися, коли є вільний час.

З іншого боку, є і [b]певні недоліки:[/b]
Більш нові ARPG привчили до швидкої прокачки персонажа. Більшої динаміки гри. А ця гра більш монотонна та повільна.
Як деяке рішення, можна в налаштуваннях гри встановити більшу швидкість — але це не суттєво змінює динаміку гри.

P.S. Ключ до гри дали безкоштовно. Здається, на Humble Bundle. А DLC, як завжди, купую під час розпродажу в Steam.

184054773.review:
Lo jugué por primera vez hace casi 20 años y me encantó, y fue recién después de jugarlo de grande que lo pude "dar vuelta" por primera vez. Se sintió como conquistar el Olimpo, la verdad.

El juego se siente como si el Age of Mythology fuese un RPG. Los NPCs están buenos, los enemigos son desafiantes y están muy bien hechos, te llevan a optimizar las estrategias porque hay algunos que son derechamente inmunes a la magia o a los golpes físicos y no todas las clases tienen un acceso factible a las habilidades necesarias (pero también te dan la opción de hacer la run de correr en círculos mientras tus pets se encargan, ya lo probé). La variedad de builds que podés hacer es tremenda, aunque siento que hay skills en todas las ramas que son derechamente mejores que otras de su nivel.

Siento que lo único malo que tiene es que se torna bastante repetitivo en algunas zonas de mobs, más allá de que si no vas con cuidado es probable que te agarren por sorpresa y te maten antes de que te des cuenta de que te estaban cascoteando. Rejugarlo en niveles de dificultad superiores también se vuelve un poco repetitivo y tedioso, aunque si recompensa un montón por las mejoras de equipamiento.

This is a classic game, if you haven't played it, you really should. I remember back in 2006 gloating after this game, but my pc was pos. I delivered newspaper advertisements for a couple of years to get a proper pc with HD4850, and finally i could run the damn thing. Needless to say it was great!

Also inventory space feels kind of restrictive for 2024 standards.

However, it is still an absolute classic of a game, and if you haven't played it before you really should. But nowadays if you are thinking between getting Grim Dawn or this, just get GD first.

Als RPG-Fan kenne ich die Titan Quest Reihe. Habe bis jetzt aber noch keinen Teil gespielt.
Die Titan Quest Anniversary Edition, die Steam vor etlicher Zeit mal verschenkt hat, kam da also wie gelegen.

Die positiven Punkte vorweg:
- nette Story
- alles deutsch vertont und übersetzt (zumindest in den paar Stunden, in den ich gespielt habe)
- gute Grafik
- verständliches Spieldesign
- Langzeitspaß durch verschiedene Klassen und Kombinationen

Diese positiven Aspekte werden jedoch recht schnell von zwei negativen erschlagen, die für mich das Spiel auf Langzeit nicht spielbar machen:

- bei der Steuerung hat sich jemand überlegt, den Bewegungs- und Angriffsbefehl, auf die gleiche Taste (linke Maustaste) zu legen. Trifft man als also nicht genau den Gegner (die sich teilweise auch recht schnell bewegen), wird aus meinem Bogenschützen recht schnell ein Nahkämpfer. Bei all der Anniversary Edition wurde hier anscheinend auch vergessen, diese Steuerung umstellbar zu machen.

- meiner Meinung nach droppen die Gegner viel zu viele Items. Die meiste Zeit bin ich damit beschäftigt, Loot zu vergleichen, zu verkaufen und allgemein mein Inventar auszuräumen. Das verlangsamt den Spielfluss unnötig.

Fazit: Gutes RPG-Spiel, keine Frage. Für mich jedoch nicht geeignet, da es mehr anstrengend ist als es Spaß macht.

Мне нечего сказать по игре. Играю в это лет с 8-ми. Сейчас мне 24. Она для меня, как родной дворик или первая песочница. Никогда не забуду, тебя - легенда. Столько времени было убито, столько невероятных сохранений потеряно, сколько Тифонов повержено, одно могу сказать, не жалею ни секунды.

Однако с момента моих 8-ми лет, игра выросла вместе со мной, даже не на голову, а на много голов. Я всё еще в всоторге с дополнения севера, хоть оно и казалось чужеродным, после многих лет в иммортал троне. Но когда-то и царство аида было чужеродным.
В обще это диаблойд в мифологической тематике с своей системой прокачки, которая может затянуть на много часов.

My favourite game from my childhood, it's so nostalgic playing through Greece, Egypt and Orient again but also with some improvements with the Anniversary Edition.

[b] Setting [/b] - is so good, it's probably my favourite thing about this game. The atmosphere was done perfectly right, it feels so fitting and alive in all 3 regions. There's a great variety of monsters from the myths and legends, and the map is designed very well.

[b] Gameplay [/b] - for me is fun. The only other ARPG hack-n-slash I've ever played was Grim Dawn, but I prefer the setting and world in Titan Quest much more, so I didn't mind any outdated gameplay mechanics or anything like that. It was really fun, especially in multiplayer, and the mastery system is awesome, I've always loved it.

[b] Story [/b] - I guess most people won't really care about the story in a game like this, but story is always #1 most important thing for me, so I talked with every possible NPC in the game and finished all the side quests.
And it's actually a good story, especially since I love the ancient mythology. This game unironically taught me about mythology when I was a kid.

Love this game and it will always hold a special place for me. I also played all the DLC's bc I was so excited seeing TQ getting new stuff after 15 years, but they were kinda underwhelming with the exception of Ragnarok.

8/10
